item.title: About
item.description: me I am a life-long computer nerd, an athlete, and a Professional Developer (I prefer the term coder). I thrive on learning and mastering new things. The intent of this site is to share occasional notes, ideas, and interesting topics that I come across in my daily work life.

item.title: Get Hugo Up and Running
item.description: Here’s a quick reference for getting Hugo installed and running on a local Ubuntu 18.04 box. It also details the installation of the Coder theme and running the server. snap install hugo --channel=extended git submodule add https://github.com/luizdepra/hugo-coder.git themes/hugo-coder hugo server --buildDrafts This information was gleaned from: https://gohugo.io/getting-started/installing/#linux https://github.com/luizdepra/hugo-coder/

item.title: Format Email Headers for Jira
item.description: On a daily basis I find myself forwarding emails to Jira Tickets. When Jira puts the text of the email into an attached comment, the email header is added as text. I like to see that header neatly formatted, so I wrote a Python script to quickly formatted that text before I send it to Jira. #!/usr/bin/env python3 import pyperclip def main(): cliptext = pyperclip.paste() try: formatted_lines = [] lines = [line for line in cliptext.
